result.execSummary:
The defendant Randy L. Will was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (4th), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Any vehicle titled or registered in defendant's name are ordered to have IID installed and IID is ordered on defendant himeself. To be installed within 14 days.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant must be in full compliance with Driver's Safety Plan.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

timeConds.notes: 30 days to be served. 30 days I&S as defendant is eligible for SSTOP program. With huber for work/treatment if defendant qualifies under jail classification system. To begin at PO's discretion but within 45 days..

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Randy L. Will

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Plea Hearing held 8-4-15 before Judge Grau

records.descr: Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt:
Clerk Cheree
Cases 15CM895 and 15TR2122 called: 9:25am
State appears by ADA S.Brubacher; Defendant appears in person/pro se.
  
State moves to:
15TR2122>>DISMISS
COURT GRANTS ABOVE

PLEA:
15CM895 - Ct. 1 (OWI 4th)>>GUILTY

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, def is competent to represent self; a factual basis & def guilty.

COURT ORDERS: Sentence W/held; 3 years probation.
CONDITIONS: $1694 inclusive;  60 DAYS MCJ Total: 30 days to be served with 30 days I&S as Defendant is eligible for SSTOP Program, w/huber for work/treatment if defendant qualifies under jail classification system, to begin at the discretion of PO but within 45 days.   Any vehicles titled and registered in the defendant's name are ordered to have IID installed and IID is ordered on defendant him/herself, both for a period of 26 months; IID to be installed within 14 days; $50 IID surcharge to be paid; Defendant must be in full compliance with driver's safety plan, IID order and DL rev order as conditions of probation; AODA (deemed already completed); Absolute sobriety; 26 month DL rev w/credit.

Adj: 9:36am

Shall not consume alcohol.  Shall not drive a motor vehicle without valid driver's license.  No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores or Beer Tents  Contact Attic Correctional Services at 715-848-3206 within 5 business days.
Ltr from Marathon County Sheriff's Dept re issuance of PAC citation L360562-6
